intro: Reichardia decapetala, commonly known as the nine-petaled daisy, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems that bear the flowers. Reichardia decapetala is often found in disturbed soils and can serve as an indicator of wetland environments.
